It starts out small really-a cup of coffee delivered with a smooth tease of "Looking a bit too dead there Spooky" and a satisfaction of watching the Dark Knight actually take a sip out of said cup. Months of effort and shared secrets disguised as routine slowly chip away at the carefully curated personality of the man that is Batman. Hal is patient- he is quite literally the embodiment of pure will. But the real breakthrough doesn't come during a world ending crisis. It happens after a grueling League meeting, when the Bat finally runs out of steam. He doesn't collapse from a villain's blow, but from the invisible, grinding weight of his own masks.
